main event: A possible balloon sighting was reported in Birmingham, Alabama, on June 5, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as circular and flat, approximately 40-50 feet in diameter., The sighting lasted for about 25 minutes., The object ascended to the south and had a color described as brilliant or silvery., Witnesses included Major Arnold B. Zimmerman and Major Robert L. Collier who were flying in a T-33 aircraft., Both officers noted the object spinning and described the weather conditions as clear with good visibility.
sighted object: a circular and flat object, possibly a balloon
witness description: Major Arnold B. Zimmerman and Major Robert L. Collier
